node.title: Two staff members injured in Kansas school shooting, police say
node.description: The staff members are in stable condition, according to police.

node.title: Russia blocks Facebook and Twitter access
node.description: The Kremlin claimed Facebook had discriminated against Russian media.

node.title: Stocks tumble as Ukraine war overshadows robust jobs report
node.description: Investors unnerved after Russian shelling causes fire at Europe's largest nuclear plant.

node.title: Pence to tell GOP donors party has no room "for apologists for Putin"
node.description: Trump recently called the Russian president "smart" and "savvy."

node.title: FTC: Weight Watchers diet app collected data on young children
node.description: WW unit allegedly violated child privacy law by collecting personal information without parental consent.

node.title: S&P Dow Jones booting all Russia stocks from its indices
node.description: The index giant also said it is stripping Russia of its "emerging market" designation given the "deterioration" in its markets.

node.title: Phoenix women's debut season ends in defeat
node.description: The Wellington Phoenix women's team have finished their maiden A-League season with a 3-1 loss to Perth.

node.title: Amtrak engineer cleared in trial over high-speed crash that killed 8 people
node.description: Eight people died and over 200 were injured when the train rounded a curve at more than twice the speed limit and derailed in north Philadelphia.

node.title: Lukoil gas stations in U.S. face backlash over Ukraine war
node.description: New Jersey officials vote to suspend licenses of local Lukoil gas stations amid consumer protests.

node.title: Former Three Percenter says he took a gun to January 6 Capitol attack
node.description: Rocky Hardy also testified that January 6 defendant Guy Reffitt brought firearms to the Washington, D.C., area.

node.title: NZ skiers strong medal contenders at Winter Paralympics
node.description: New Zealand has three alpine skiers competing at the Beijing Winter Paralympics over the next 10 days with two of them strong medal contenders again.

node.title: State landlord's board chair 'greatly let down' over breach of political neutrality
node.description: Kainga Ora's board chair Vui Mark Gosche told RNZ he felt "greatly let down" about the cover up he first heard about through the Minister of Housing Megan Woods.

node.title: Court curbs U.S. authority to expel migrant families to some countries
node.description: Both the Trump and Biden administrations have said the Title 42 border policy is necessary to control the spread of COVID-19 inside migrant holding facilities.

node.title: Club rugby's biggest challenge in 2022 - clarity around Covid-19
node.description: Comment: There is serious concern over how the pandemic and vaccinations are going to affect the national game in the upcoming season, writes Jamie Wall. Video

node.title: Supreme Court rules in favor of FBI in Muslim surveillance case
node.description: The court ruled unanimously.

node.title: As hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians flee, many stay behind
node.description: "Every day begins with a text to our relatives," says 16-year-old Dennis. "We ask, 'are you alive?'"

node.title: McMaster: Ukraine war will likely "bleed over" into other countries
node.description: The former national security adviser told "CBS Mornings" it is very likely that the turmoil could spread to other countries.

node.title: Australian cricket legend Shane Warne dead at age 52
node.description: Fox Sports television quoted a family statement as saying he died of a suspected heart attack in Thailand.

node.title: Book excerpt: Dolly Parton & James Patterson's "Run, Rose, Run"
node.description: The music superstar and the bestselling author team up for a novel about an aspiring country singer-songwriter.

node.title: New Russian law threatens reporters with lengthy prison sentences
node.description: As the war in Ukraine grinds on, most Russians are unaware of what is really happening amid a new crackdown on the few remaining independent media outlets.

node.title: India faces mounting pressure to condemn Russia over Ukraine invasion
node.description: India is the only major U.S. ally that has neither condemned Russia's invasion of Ukraine​ in clear terms nor backed sanctions against the country.

node.title: Ukrainian team making it to Beijing Paralympics called a "miracle"
node.description: "Our presence at the Paralympics is not merely a presence, this is a sign that Ukraine is and will remain a country,"​ the team's committee president said.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 22,527 new community cases, 562 in hospital, five deaths
node.description: There have been 22,527 new community cases of Covid-19 reported today, slightly down on yesterday's numbers, the Ministry of Health says.

node.title: Supreme Court reimposes death sentence for Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokar Tsarnaev
node.description: The court ruled 6-3 along ideological lines.

node.title: Mila Kunis vows to match $3M in donations for Ukrainian refugees
node.description: "I have never been more proud to be a Ukrainian," said Kunis, who immigrated to the U.S. from the country in 1991.

node.title: GOP governors call on White House to boost domestic energy production
node.description: The statement was signed by 25 of the nation's 28 Republican governors.

node.title: Staff at Russian news channel walks off set
node.description: The channel's website was shut down by the government. It is not the only outlet that has had to stop broadcasting.

node.title: "Reading Rainbow" to return this weekend as an interactive streaming program
node.description: The next program won't air on PBS like its predecessor, but its format will be familiar to the remote learning generation.

node.title: Job market still chugging even as economic risks grow
node.description: U.S. employers added 678,000 jobs in February, while the nation's unemployment rate fell to 3.8%.

node.title: Sen. Graham urges Russians to target Putin: "Take this guy out"
node.description: The South Carolina senator called for a "Brutus in Russia" to "step up to the plate."
